what I have to change inside the spawn_npc.py to get a specific car? 
Such as just spawing mustangs.
author: rikMaz

comments.body:
spawn_npc.py is designed to spawn a car of random blueprint. This is specified in line 76:
`
blueprint = random.choice(blueprints)
`

If you want to get a specific car, you need to assign blueprint to it. For example:
`
blueprint = world.get_blueprint_library().find("vehicle.ford.mustang")
`

By the way, I got the name of all vehicles available from running vehicle_gallery.py. It shows the name of each blueprint. You can modify this script to run faster to get all the names quickly.
You can also just print your blueprint library to see all available vehicles.

title: Synchronize Server
body: I know this feature is currently not implemented, but can you give me a hint how to easily implement a do_tick() function, stepping through the simulator frames?
author: Sakrust

comments.body:
Not so difficult but not so trivial either. Basically, you would need to port the synchronous mode we had in 0.8.x API and make it work with the new system. I think the main complication comes from the fact that you have now any number of clients, so I client has to somehow tell the simulator to wait for it every tick, and we have to decide if we want to have just one or multiple "synchronous clients".

This is however among the top tasks of our priority list, we expect to have this implemented soon, during January or February.

I started the carla server in this way:
    ./CarlaUE4.sh -benchmark -fps=10 -windowed

And then run manual_control.py. I'm sure manual_control.py is connecting to the carla server started just now in that I can see the same vehicle in the same position in pygame and server scene. But in the hud, the server FPS is always around 30 despite the value of fps flag, which is almost the same as when I started the carla server without benchmark and fps flags. I'm very confused about it. Appreciate any suggestion. Thanks.
author: tanglrHello

comments.body:
Hi @tanglrHello,

The FPS shown in the "manual_control.py" is measured in real-time, with a timer, just to test the performance of the server. What you may want to see is the simulation-time, e.g.
```diff
--- a/PythonAPI/manual_control.py
+++ b/PythonAPI/manual_control.py
@@ -307,7 +307,7 @@ class HUD(object):
 
     def on_world_tick(self, timestamp):
         self._server_clock.tick()
-        self.server_fps = self._server_clock.get_fps()
+        self.server_fps = 1.0 / timestamp.delta_seconds
         self.frame_number = timestamp.frame_count
         self.simulation_time = timestamp.elapsed_seconds
```
It works! Thank you so much.

In my understanding, if I set the fps of the simulator to 10, OnTick() will be executed 10 times per second. If I spawn a sensor in the carla world and add a callback function for the sensor, the callback function will also be executed 10 times per second at the same pace with OnTick(). But when I add a print time command in _parse_image() of manual_control.py, it shows the print lines are around 30 times in a single second, which means the callback function are executed 30 times per second. And as I modified the code in the way you suggested, server fps in hud is around 10.
I'd like to know what is wrong with my comprehension. Expecting your reply. Thank you!

`OnTick()` callbacks are called 10 times per _simulation-second_, but it's actually called as fast as your hardware is able to compute. Meaning, every object in the simulation sees steps of 0.1ms, but you will observe the simulation like moving fast-forward. On the opposite, if you set an FPS of say 500, the vehicles are updated 500 times per _simulation-second_, but you'll observe the simulation in slow motion.

In other words, if you run with `-benchmark -fps=60`, save the images, and play them at 60 fps the video will look real-time.
It's clear to me now. Thanks for the reply!

title: Available vehicle library and Default vehicle
body:
Hello everyone,

I am using CARLA 0.8.4 and I am trying to run it by changing default vehicle to two wheeled vehicle, but I am not able to.

I have seen that I can change the model in initial settings at, 'PlayerVehicle', like this
"PlayerVehicle=/Game/Blueprints/Vehicles/BmwGrandTourer/BmwGranTourer.BmwGranTourer_C"

But my problem is, I am not able to find these blueprints (Since I have not built CARLA from source, but just using pre-compiled versions). Can someone help me in finding models for bike?

Note: As it is easy enough to change the default vehicle by knowing the models and path, I think it would be good idea to have a text file with all the vehicle models available. It will make it easier for the documentation.

PS: Please excuse me if this question is really basic or if there is already such file existing. I have not been in touch with CARLA from past few months.
author: n-akram

comments.body:
Hi @n-akram, sorry for the late response, we were on vacations.

You are totally right about it.

## Cars
Format:
```ini
PlayerVehicle=/Game/Blueprints/Vehicles/Model/Model.Model_C
```
Example
```ini
PlayerVehicle=/Game/Blueprints/Vehicles/AudiA2/AudiA2.AudiA2_C
```
And these are the models:
```
AudiA2
AudiTT
BmwGrandTourer
BmwIsetta
CarlaCola
ChevroletImpala
CitroenC3
DodgeChargePolice
JeepWranglerRubicon
Mercedes
Mini
Mustang
NissanMicra
NissanPatrol
SeatLeon
Tesla
ToyotaPrius
VolkswagenT2
```
Except for the `BmwGrandTourer` that someone missed the `d` on the file name

## Bikes
Format:
```ini
/Game/Blueprints/Vehicles/2Wheeled/Model/Model.Model_C
```
Example
```ini
/Game/Blueprints/Vehicles/2Wheeled/CrossBike/CrossBikeBP.CrossBikeBP_C
```

And these are the models:
```
CrossBike/CrossBikeBP.CrossBikeBP_C
Harley/HarleyBP.HarleyBP_C
KawasakiNinja/KawasakiNinjaBP.KawasakiNinjaBP_C
LeisureBike/LeisureBikeBP.LeisureBikeBP_C
RoadBike/roadBikeBP.roadBikeBP_C
Vespa/VespaBP.VespaBP_C
Yamaha/YamahaBp.YamahaBp_C
```

I wrote all of them because in this case there is a general misspelling of upper case and lower case (I don't know if it really matters in Unreal), also a `BP` at the end of the file.

I'm sure our artists will fix it soon!

Hope it help!
Let me reopen this issue until the spelling errors got fixed :)

Hi @yangzuyuanhao 

Please, open your road's model and check "simple collision" under "collision drawing options" to see the mesh collider.
A common problem when trying to import big road models into Unreal is that the automatic collision generated when importing goes far up trying to cover the entire model with very few polygons. If this is true for your model you could either delete your simple collision and generate one manually yourself (Most efficient) or, in the details panel of the mesh, under collision, change collision complexity to "Use Complex Collision as Simple" this way it will use all the geometry of the model as collision (This option is a bit more costly but will probably work right away).

title: binocular vision
body:
How many cameras on the car? 
Can I get two images from two cameras(left camera and right camera, if there is)?

thanks!
author: Archiewyq

comments.body:
Hi @Archiewyq 

you can add cameras using carla settings, either with the CarlaSettings.ini file or directly in your client. This is a stereo setup I use in my python client:
```py
# RGB Sensor left
camera0 = Camera('Camera_left', PostProcessing='SceneFinal')
camera0.set_image_size(WINDOW_WIDTH, WINDOW_HEIGHT)
camera0.set_position(0.30, 0, 1.30)
settings.add_sensor(camera0)

# RGB Sensor right
camera1 = Camera('Camera_right', PostProcessing='SceneFinal')
camera1.set_image_size(WINDOW_WIDTH, WINDOW_HEIGHT)
camera1.set_position(0.30, 0.30, 1.30)
settings.add_sensor(camera1)
```
By setting the position of the individual cameras you can adjust them to be left or right. Define WINDOW_WIDTH and WINDOW_HEIGHT for your desired output or change the values to something like 800 and 600.

title: Low performance on windows
body:
In trying to run CARLA with flag `-carla-server` the performance is dramatically slow down, FPS = 3. In the same time when running CARLA without this flag everything works fine.

Environment:
 * Windows 10 Pro, 16Gb RAM
 * Geforce GTX 770
 * CARLA release 0.8.2 (Compiled version)
author: habibutsu

comments.body:
Hi @habibutsu!

Assuming you are running a python client and everithing is connected properly, I think you have a GPU problem. When you are running without `-carla-server` and is not connecting to any client, the simulator only have 1 camera (for visualization). But when you use `-carla-server`, depending which client or configuration are you using, the simulator is using your GPU to render more cameras (sensors) simultaneously. 
This may cause low FPS with old hardware...

@marcgpuig I am not still connected to the server when it already work very slow. For example when i am trying to move corresponded window it to do hard because it responsive very slow. In the same if to open task manager then can see that GPU and CPU not loaded.

Simple script presented below take a time is around `1m25.607s`

```python
import cv2

from carla.client import make_carla_client
from carla.sensor import Camera, Lidar
from carla.settings import CarlaSettings
from carla.tcp import TCPConnectionError
from carla.util import print_over_same_line

host = '192.168.100.6'
port = 2000
player_start = 0

settings = CarlaSettings()

camera0 = Camera('CameraRGB')
camera0.set_image_size(800, 600)
camera0.set_position(0.30, 0, 1.30)
settings.add_sensor(camera0)


def save_image(filename, image):
    if image.max() < 200:
        image = image * 255
    cv_img = cv2.cvtColor(image, cv2.COLOR_RGB2BGR)
    cv2.imwrite(filename, cv_img)


with make_carla_client(host, port) as client:
    print('connected...')

    scene = client.load_settings(settings)
    client.start_episode(player_start)

    client.send_control(
        steer=0,
        throttle=2,
        brake=0.0,
        hand_brake=False,
        reverse=False)

    for frame in range(0, 10):
        print(frame)
        measurements, sensor_data = client.read_data()
        image = sensor_data['CameraRGB'].data

        save_image(f'screen{frame:02}.png', image)
```

Hi @habibutsu.
I think I can't completely understand you. If the client (the python program) is not connected to the server (the Unreal Engine game), both programs are waiting trying to connect each other so it is normal they are responsively very slow. And that's why the GPU and the CPU are not bussy. So your problem and this _low FPS_ is because the game (simulator) is not _running_ until a client connect to it (when you use `-carla-server`).
Hi, Is there a way to save your camera images in any other format other than png format ?

title: Simulate specific Lidar geometrics
body:
Hi, 
Is it be possible to accurately define specific Lidar geometrics? At the moment I see we can define the number of channels, the upper and lower FOVs, and the total number of points, but these variables do not accurately describe the geometric model of a sensor.

In example, I want to simulate a Velodyne HDL64 sensor, and for that I would need to set a specific horizontal step of the lidar rotation. In addition, for this sensor the separation between the lower layers is different from the upper ones, so it would be useful to introduce a vector with the vertical FOV of each layer.
author: vvaquero

title: Where is /Game/Maps/Town02 located, Windows version?
body: I just beginning to use the simulator, and did some work with the default `Town01`, my question is where is `Town02` located I can't find it anywhere, I must be missing something.
author: m090009

comments.body: usually it's in .\Carla_0.8.2\PythonClient\carla\planner
So how can I run the simulator with **Town02**, I did this  `CarlaUE4.exe /Game/Maps/Town02` but neither `maps` nor `Game` folders are in the Windows installation

It refers to the Unreal project content folder, so, it's inside the .pak file of the build version (each platform has different pak files, example: \CarlaUE4\Content\Paks\CarlaUE4-WindowsNoEditor.pak ) but if you open the editor it would be something like CARLA/Unreal/CarlaUE4/Content/Maps/Town02.umap
Ok, So is there a way form me to run the Windows build version with Town02?

Yes, for example with the version 0.8.2 it should be something like this:

> CarlaUE4.exe /Game/Maps/Town02 -windowed -ResX=640 -ResY=480

notice that the map is the first parameter.
We will include an option for [LevelSettings] in CarlaSettings.ini called MapName to change the map also.
Thanks a lot @juaxix , its working now. Yeah levelSetting would be great for pre-programmed sim.

Hello,@juaxix 
Is there any way to add my own map into  the .pak file of the build version? so I could run carla by `./CarlaUE4.sh /Game/Maps/mymap ` and could load my own map.
@JackRen88 have you solved your problem. I now create a map and then I use the "make package" to create a package, but I cannot find my map in the Maps folder.

this works for me
CarlaUE4.exe Town01  --carla-server

> Hello,@juaxix
> Is there any way to add my own map into the .pak file of the build version? so I could run carla by `./CarlaUE4.sh /Game/Maps/mymap ` and could load my own map.

Have you found a solution?

> Hello,@juaxix Is there any way to add my own map into the .pak file of the build version? so I could run carla by `./CarlaUE4.sh /Game/Maps/mymap ` and could load my own map.

Any solution on this?

So I managed to do it and I hope this will help someone in the future.

RoadRunner:

Create your map and export it using Carla Filmbox, you get .xodr and .fbx files inside of a Exports folder inside of your RoadRunner project

Carla (Source build):

1. Take .fbx and .xodr file and place them into the Import folder
2. Using x64 VS 2019 cmd window while being at the root of your Carla folder, run make import ARGS="--package=exp_town"
3. You will get your package created inside of [Carla root]\Unreal\CarlaUE4\Content\exp_town (default is map_package)
4. Once that is done, you will be able to open this map inside of your Unreal Carla Editor where you can do further customization, like adding a spawn point, etc ...
5. Once you're done editing, using the x64 VS 2019 cmd from the root Carla folder, run make package ARGS="--packages=exp_town"
6. When that finishes you will get one zip file and one folder with the same names inside of [Carla root]\Build\UE4Carla
7. Now simply take that zip file and distribute it whereever you want and use the python config.py --map "map_name" command to change the map in your NoEditor Carla Server. What I do is since I have a VM where I keep my source built Carla I take that folder and transfer the contents of it to my binary built Carla on my local computer.

> It refers to the Unreal project content folder, so, it's inside the .pak file of the build version (each platform has different pak files, example: \CarlaUE4\Content\Paks\CarlaUE4-WindowsNoEditor.pak ) but if you open the editor it would be something like CARLA/Unreal/CarlaUE4/Content/Maps/Town02.umap

`the map specified on the commandline '/Game/Carla/Maps/Town01' couldn't be found. Would you like to load the default map instead? `. 

And I want to edit the .pak file but I can't open it , could u give me some suggestion how to solve it.

title: Setting multi-agent in one server for Reinforcement Learning
body:
Hello,

I am planning to use Carla to train some RL algorithms. The idea I would like to implement is that in stead of running multiple servers with one agent in each server, I would like to set multiple agent (i.e. cars sending their own camera image and their own information) in the same game instance.
I think that this would be way more computational efficient and allows more agent running on a single computer.
Is that a feature not or currently implemented or is that already possible with some setup needed?
author: marintoro

comments.body:
Hi @marintoro,

Sorry but this is not currently implemented yet.
But hey, good news! @nsubiron just start working on it ;)

Anyway, we need to test if it is really _more computational efficient_, because Unreal is _not designed_ to render a bunch of cameras simultaneously. We'll see :)

Thank you for your reply. "way more computational efficient" was maybe a bit strong indeed! ;)

Actually, I implemented this multi-agent settings in Unity (not UE4), each of this agent were invisible and didn't collide with each other. It was speeding up the total frame rate on a single machine by a factor around 4/5 (I was launching only one game instance with around 16 reinforcement learning agents instead of launching 16 game instances each with one agent). 
But it's true that this performance gap was in fact really interesting only with a little number of agent in each game instance (i.e from 1 agent to around 10...). 
Using 1000 agents was really close to be 10 times slower than setting 100 agents for example...

Well @marintoro it makes a lot of sense.

Thanks for the information and the feedback. We will do these tests when we get a first version of this multi client :)

I close this issue because is already a feature request.

title: Workflow for developing sensors - slow performance
body:
Hi all

I'm attempting to change the carla code base to collect data for one of my custom scenarios. I haven't changed any code yet (pulled master this afternoon). I've got the code building and running from within the Unreal Engine, but I'm seeing some odd behavior. When I run from within the unreal editor without the server (i.e. UseNetworking=false in CarlaSettings.ini), everything runs fine (fps > 60). When I run from within the editor with the server enabled (i.e. UseNetworking=true in CarlaSettings.ini), the simulator runs really slowly (<3 FPS). Also, I cannot get any sensor data - whenever I call client.read_data() (e.g. in client_example.py), I get an AssertionError (len(raw_data) < 4 * width * height). 

Is this expected? Ultimately, I'm just interested in exposing additional data streams in the python client, so I'd also be happy if there's another way to test that as well.
author: mitchellspryn

comments.body:
So, I found a few interesting things:

1) The AssertionError is my fault. I was mixing the python client from the stable branch, and the code from the latest master. It's likely that the packet definition has changed. Updating the python client to the latest fixed this.

2) If I start the python client before starting the simulator in the editor, everything works as expected (I get ~20 FPS, which is fine). If I start the simulator, and then start the python client, everything is slow (<3 FPS). Does anyone know why this happens?

Hi @mitchellspryn,

Is it possible that the low FPS happens when the editor doesn't have the focus?

From our FAQ

>  **Why do I have very low FPS when running the server in Unreal Editor?**
> UE4 Editor goes to a low performance mode when out of focus. It can be disabled in the editor preferences. Go to "Edit->Editor Preferences->Performance" and disable the "Use Less CPU When in Background" option.

I did that already. 

Let me clarify my question. I'm not asking why the FPS is lower - I understand that running via the editor has an overhead. I'm asking why the perf hit is dependent on the order in which I start the server / client.
I am not able to reproduce it, in our tests we get same performance no matter the order. I can't think of anything that could depend in the order in which you start the server and client.
Fair enough. I was able to repro on two of my machines. Ultimately, it really doesn't matter - when I build the executable, it works fine. Thanks for attempting to repro.

title: What is -carla-no-networking flag?
body:
What does the `-carla-no-networking` option do?
By disabling networking, is it not possible for a client to connect to the server?

Is it the same as setting `UseNetworking=false` in the `CarlaSettings.ini` file?

The comment in the settings file reads:
> If set to false, a mock controller will be used instead of waiting for a real client to connect.

So what does a mock controller here mean?
Where does the controls for the mock controller come from? Are they random?

Thanks :)
author: GokulNC

comments.body:
Hi @GokulNC,

> What does the `-carla-no-networking` option do?

It disables networking **regardless** what you have in `UseNetworking` in `CarlaSettings.ini` file.
Useful for a quick test without changing `CarlaSettings.ini`.

> By disabling networking, is it not possible for a client to connect to the server?

Indeed. This way you can drive the car directly from the server without a client but your keyboard.
We use this to test that the server works, for debug or just for showing CARLA to people :)

> So what does a mock controller here mean?

Internally the server is just a controller for the game. The mock controller is a dummy controller that just enables the keyboard input, this way you can use carla without a client.

Regards!

Thanks @marcgpuig 

I tried setting `UseNetworking=false` in my `CarlaSettings.ini`, but eventhough, my client is able to connect to the server and send controls to it and it's working.
Is this a bug?

We have a known issue #215.
Could be your problem?

No, that's not my problem.
The path I gave is relative and it works and loads `CarlaSettings.ini`

So the problem is not with the file being not loaded.

Hi @GokulN,

Any progress on the subject?
Unfortunately, I can not reproduce your error :(

The problem was, eventhough I had set `UseNetworking=false` in `CarlaSettings.ini`, my client was able to connect to the server and send/receive messages.

I had that problem in Carla 0.7 ..
Now even I'm unable to reproduce the problem since Carla 0.8
So most probably it was silently fixed since that version or whatever.

And the main reason I created this issue was to ask the doubt in the OP.
So I'm closing the issue. Sorry for the delay :)

title: where is implemention of the function SpawnVehicle() in  VehicleSpawnerBase.h?
body:
Hello,
I'm currently reading your awesome code but I find something very confusing that in VehicleSpawnerBase.h, there's a SpawnVehicle() which I can't find the implemention.
Where's it?
Thank you.
author: barontxu

comments.body:
Hi @barontxu, good catch ;) the function is implemented in the derived _"VehicleSpawner"_ Blueprint; note that it is marked as `UFUNCTION(BlueprintImplementableEvent)`. When you call this function you are triggering a blueprint event.

The C++ code decides when and where the vehicle is spawned, but the Blueprint decides the model and color of the vehicle. This way the C++ code doesn't need to know about the assets.
@nsubiron Yes i see. Do we have to spawn actor in blueprint? I tried c++, but the car i spawned just can't move.
@nsubiron And thanks much to your swiftly respond. You're so nice.

It should work in C++ too. Just make sure the vehicle is a subclass of `ACarlaWheeledVehicle` and follow all the steps in `AVehicleSpawnerBase::SpawnVehicleAtSpawnPoint()` function (you need to spawn the controller and give it a road map).
Yes, that should work
Thank you. I'll give it a try.

title: Integrating motion planning algorithms in
body: Is it possible to integrate motion planning algorithms like RRT* inside CARLA, and draw the tree expansion when running the simulator, I can help with the implementation of RRT* and other motion planning algorithms, but where will be the most appropriate place to implement these algorithms and how it's possible to draw lines in scene from the code, to show the tree expansion.
author: MFaisalZaki

comments.body:
Hello !
Where exactly do you want to show the tree expansion. In a 2D  map or inside the game. For implementing the motion planning in a higher level it is quite straightforward. Basically check the manual_control.py example with the -m option. There you will see all the information you could access, like position on map, lane orientation, other agents position. With this you could program your rrt. We would be happy to see your results ! 

Cheers

I was thinking to integrate tree expansion in the game itself, and my plan is to implement different RRT based algorithms inside CALRA itself to have a variety of motion planning algorithms which can be used by AI cars.

This also can help creating a standard benchmark for RRT based algorithms, where every researcher can use CARLA's integrated motion planning algorithms to check his algorithm performance and then can integrate his work.

What do u think ?

I can create a hack, but it would be good to know if you already have a pre-built solution to this.  Thanks!

x11vnc will pipe everything through vnc:

x11vnc -rfbauth ~/.vnc/passwd  -display :0 -forever -bg -repeat -nowf -o ~/.vnc/x11vnc.log

title: Is there a way to generate a map better than just drag spline repeater?
body:
I came across most parts of code and learn that for now, map generator only supports 90 degree straight road generation, but there's another way to generate roads that can be in any angle and curly, which is **spline mesh repeater**, I see in doc. But using this method seems very cumbersome, we have to drag point in ue editor. And there's a collision issue in this **repeater**,
Is there a better way such as use a script to generate map? Or will there be a resolution recently?
Thank you!
author: tanisxu

comments.body:
Hi @tanisxu,

We only support 90 degree straight roads for now. Keep in mind that if you generate a road with the spline repeater the lane information will be missing, meaning the vehicle will appear always as driving off-road and the autopilot won't work. However, if you still want to use it you can easily script it with Unreal blueprints.

We will soon start working on a better map generator with curvy roads and a varying number of lanes, but it will take time as it is a fairly complex addition.

@nsubiron Thanks for the warm and quick answering all the time. May I ask how long will the curly(and maybe, with height) map generator takes? And will you add height to map?
Thanks again.

@tanisxu Yes, we plan to have maps with changes in height. We plan to work on this along this coming year, but I cannot be more specific with deadlines since we haven't planned yet how we will do it and how many features we will add.
@nsubiron Thank you for your answer. May I ask how long will the curly road map generator takes?
@tanisxu Sorry, we don't know yet. We'll be more specific once we start working on it.
@nsubiron Thanks all the same.

title: Changing driving viewpoint in server

comments.body: Hi, you can toggle the view with "tab". Unreal wrongly picks "alt+tab" shortcuts and changes the view when you change the window.

title: How can I train my own model under text mode ?
body:
When we start Carla, a 3 dimension rendered scenario comes out. So we can intuitively get information about where the car is , what the speed is, what the front camera view is ... 
But rendering on screen is useless during training model and it costs lots of computing power.
So I want to know if there is a method to train model without rendering (e.g. under text mode)
Thanks a lot !
author: XiaoZzai

comments.body:
Hi,
We have already considered this in the past, but we couldn't find an easy solution. We didn't put much effort into this because the performance gain is probably small, (the main thing slowing down the render are the scene captures not the main camera). One hacky thing you can do is reducing its resolution at minimum

    $ ./CarlaUE4.sh -windowed -resX=5 -resY=5

However, if you find a nicer way to deactivating the main camera we'll be very happy to hear about it :)

title: Navigation
body:
How do the AI cars navigate in Carla?

I have checked some navigation tutorials for UE4, but it seems Carla is using something more complex.
author: curantil

comments.body: We implemented our own controller, the code can be found at "WheeledVehicleAIController.cpp". We use information about the road lanes that is generated when building the map, as well as trigger volumes for traffic lights and signs.

Ok, if I understand it correctly, it works as follows:
- The map and basic navigation is created with the CarlaMapGenerator
- The player car (and if enough spawnpoints available, the non-player cars too) are spawned at a random PlayerStart. Those starts have to be placed manually on the map.
- Without anything else added, the cars will drive around at 20km/h with the preference at intersections of going straight, otherwise turning left.
- The SpeedLimiters can be used to easily change the speed the car is driving at (10km/h below the speedl limit)
- For random routes around the map, an IntersectionEntrance is used on which the different turning options can be created. Every route consists of one or more Actors that are the waypoints on that route over the intersection.
- Cars obey TrafficLights, but those lights need to be scripted to change color.

Is this correct?

Sometimes I get "Error: Controller doesn't have a roadmap!" and one or more cars will not move around. Any idea what could be the cause of this problem?

Yes, that's basically it. The intersections are handled by IntersectionEntrance, otherwise the car just go straight until it finds a road patch with defined direction.

 A couple of comments to bear in mind for future versions
  * Cars drive 10km/h below speed limit due to a bug #5 (we want to fix this but doesn't have much priority as 10km/h below is still reasonable)
  * IntersectionEntrance will be replaced by RoutePlanner, it will be added in the next release. It's a bit more efficient and the routes are displayed with splines that looks clearer.

> Sometimes I get "Error: Controller doesn't have a roadmap!" and one or more cars will not move around. Any idea what could be the cause of this problem?

Can it be that you are dragging and dropping cars directly to the scene? Or using custom vehicles?

> Can it be that you are dragging and dropping cars directly to the scene? Or using custom vehicles?

No. I didn't add any cars to the scene, only PlayerStarts nor have I created custom vehicles.

I also get the message : `Error: Requested 10 vehicles, but we were only able to spawn 1` although it successfully spawns 15 vehicles. (I have 18 PlayerStarts) Could it be something in the spawning process?

Do you have a vehicle spawner already in the map? This actor is spawned by the game mode at begin play, you should not add a second one to the scene. The one you added doesn't have a reference to the road map thus the vehicles spawned by it are also missing this ref.

> Do you have a vehicle spawner already in the map?

Alright! That seems to be the cause. I removed it and now it works. Thanks.
Could you please explain why trigger volumes are used near traffic lights and signs?

with use of that cars understand arrive near a traffic lights and signs
    On Tuesday, July 10, 2018, 2:29:16 AM GMT+4:30, Ishaan Paranjape <notifications@github.com> wrote:  
 
 
Could you please explain why trigger volumes are used near traffic lights and signs?

—
You are receiving this because you commented.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
@ishaan95 yes, as @abdoly says. The speed limit signs and traffic lights notify this way the vehicles, and the intersections use this to detect vehicles and assign them a route.

title: How can I set car start point near the NPC car?
body:
I find that during episode I can get NPC car information.
But now I have to get NPC car location before new episode starts in order to set car near the NPC car.
So What should I do ? 
Any suggestiones would be appreciated !
author: XiaoZzai

comments.body:
Hello @18605973470 ,
Unfortunately that is a bit tricky to do now in CARLA, since the starting positions
have to be selected from a list ( Please see #14). 

However, by fixing the seed, the start positions of NPC are always the same.
 An alternative solution could be:

- Set a seed for npc vechicles  ( or leave the default), the npc car seeds can
be set on CarlaSettings parameter "SeedVehicles=123456789"

- Record the start position of the all the vehicles for this seed.

- Check the start position locations and select one that is close to the npc you want.

Eventually you could keep changing the npc vehicle spawn seeds to get a situation
where the start positions and the npc positions match your needs.

Cheers

Thanks a lot !

And I also want to know what's the method to generate index according to seeds given or where is the source code about that. Getting this, I can automatically find the NPC cars' start location instead of manually doing that.
The spawning of non-player vehicles is done by "AVehicleSpawnerBase", there a random spawn pose is retrieved from the list of player starts present in the map.

In **VehicleSpawnerBase.cpp**, there is a function called **TryToSpawnRandomVehicle**. 
And I guess random index is generated here.
Digging into it, I find random number is generated through `std::uniform_int_distribution<int32>(Minimum, Maximum)(Engine)`.
Here Minimum is 0 and Maximum is 151. (start point list's length is 152)
And the **Engine** is defined as **std::minstd_rand Engine** in **RandomEngine.h** with seed 123456789 as default.
And the final random number is 145.

So I write a simple test code :
`std::minstd_rand Engine;`
`Engine.seed(123456789);`
`std::cout << std::uniform_int_distribution<int32_t>(0, 151)(Engine) << std::endl;`
But the result I get is always 8, but not 145.

So I am confused .
Are there something wrong ?

title: How to get camera intrinsic matrix?
body:
Thank you for publishing this great drive simulator code.
I am trying to map depth points(u,v,depth) from Pixel coordinates to World coordinates(x,y,z).
To do this, Camera intrinsic parameter is necessary. I found that "CameraFOV(horizontal field of view) and ImageSize (in ```CarlaSettings.ini```)" is parameters for calculating camera intrinsic matrix. I thought as following.
```
Focus_length = ImageSizeX /(2 * tan(CameraFOV * π / 360))
Center_X = ImageSizeX / 2
Center_Y = ImageSizeY / 2
```
But I found this intrinsic matrix is not correct enough because 3D points (transformed from depth points(u,v,depth) by this matrix) has some distortion. 

Could you tell me how to get camera intrinsic matrix? 

(Now I think Focus_length_per_pixel (fx, fy) or distortion parameter is necessary for this. )

[P.S.]
To confirm whether my implementation is correct, please tell me the definition of depth length in each image pixel. I think this depth is the length from Camera coordinate original point to each point.
(not simply z value in Camera coordinate)
author: syinari0123

comments.body:
Hello @syinari0123,

Sorry for the late response.

Yes, the depth is perpendicular to the projection plane.

We've been doing some experiments and we've got results without noticiable distortion.
Your code is correct to me, and the intrinsic matrix shoud be the following one:

    K = [[f, 0, Cu],
         [0, f, Cv],
         [0, 0, 1 ]]

Where Cu and Cv represents the center point of the image.

Given a 2D point ```p2d = [u,v,1]```, your world point position ```P = [X,Y,Z]``` will be:

    P = ( inv(K) * p2d ) * depth

We're working on a example integrating the point cloud with the python client.
I hope we are going to release it soon :)

Due to #58 we can't get the correct camera world rotation, but it will be fixed in the next release.

Thank you for replying.
I modified my code following as what you say, I was able to get correct result ! Thank you! :)

I thought depth is the ray length to each point from the pole (like LIDAR sensor's value, what is called, "r in polar coordinate system" ), which caused distortion in my code.
Glad it worked! :)

title: Multible camera image  and disable traffic lights？
body:
In the configuration file, I see we can set up multible cameras. I have a few questions:
1. What is the Intrinsic Camera Parameter of the cameras? I see we can set FOV.
2. If I set three cameras, how can I get image data through measuements? 
3. I have another question not related to cameras, can I disable the traffic lights?
author: s7ev3n

comments.body:
Hello @s7ev3n . Thanks for your participation.
1. You can directly set FOV and resolution. Other parameters, such as lens distortion, are not currently
supported.
2. If you set three cameras like this:
```
[CARLA/SceneCapture/CameraLeft]
PostProcessing=SceneFinal
CameraPositionY=-15.0
CameraRotationYaw=-30.0
[CARLA/SceneCapture/CameraMiddle]
CameraPositionY=0.0
PostProcessing=SceneFinal
CameraRotationYaw=0
[CARLA/SceneCapture/CameraRight]
PostProcessing=SceneFinal
CameraPositionY=15.0
CameraRotationYaw=30.0
```
You will receive three BGRA cameras from the server that would be stored in your measurements dictionary. They always come in the same order as written on the file:
measurements['BGRA'][0] # Camera Left
measurements['BGRA'][1] # Camera Middle
measurements['BGRA'][2] # Camera Right
However, this interface will change a bit in version 0.7.0, we were putting some effort on having a more clear and fast interface. We will also provide documentation.

Regarding question 3:
Currently no. That would create chaos in the city ! But maybe is an useful and not so hard to add feature. We will consider for release 0.7.1 .
@felipecode Thank you so much !

author: pei-li-u-m

comments.body:
@pei-li-u-m - You have this issue as your $SUMO_HOME/bin folder is not on the path too. Add following to the path and I think you should be fine.

```Python
os.environ['PATH'] = os.pathsep.join(
    [os.path.join(os.getenv('SUMO_HOME'),'bin'),os.getenv('PATH')])
```

Also, adding the following to Python path will also help.
```Python
sys.path.append(os.path.join(os.getenv('SUMO_HOME'),'tools'))
sys.path.append(os.path.join(os.getenv('CARLA_HOME'), 'Co-Simulation/Sumo'))
```

title: Non-player agents info for objects within the FoV of the camera only
body: Is there a way to get the ground truth of the objects only within the FoV of the camera?
author: suvam-bag

comments.body:
Hello @suvam-bag  !
At this moment we don't have such function. However, i think this could
be quite useful ! 
 From the client side, It could  be implemented from the data we already have.
The client receives the camera pose , FoV and the positions of all the objects
present in the scene. With this, one could compute a function that projects 
the camera view on the 3D space and get all the visible objects.
